availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac W. Bishop (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Bishop. Father of Lee Bishop, Misseniah Bishop, Mary A. Bishop, Tibitha E. Bishop, Dabney Bishop, Eli Bishop, Eldred G. Bishop, Lucy Bishop, and Joseph D. Bishop. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Benjamin F. Bishop as a farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 60A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 598.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 2, p. 30A-B.
Find A Grave, "Isaac Watts Bishop (1820-1876)," Memorial #91532236, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/91532236 (accessed October 19, 2020).
